description: For Mr. Johnson, if it’s Sunday, there’s probably a parade. And he will probably be dancing at it.
title: How Corey Johnson, City Council Speaker, Spends His Sundays
title_page: How Corey Johnson, City Council Speaker, Spends His Sundays - The New York Times
text:
CHILL I live on iced coffee 12 months of the year. I drink iced coffee when there’s a blizzard outside. So I usually go to L & M Deli on my corner. It’s been there for almost 40 years. That’s how I get my day going, with the largest iced coffee you’ve ever seen. I’ve been going there for like 15 years. Sometimes I’ll get an English muffin. I’m not a big breakfast person.
CALENDAR I’ll come back home and see what the big events of the day are. In summer there’s usually a lot of parades, especially on Sunday. I read the papers, and then I’m usually scrolling through Twitter.
